intro: Glyceria maritima var. foucaudii, commonly known as the coastal glyceria, is a variant of the grass species native to coastal regions. Its flowering stems produce small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny florets. Glyceria maritima var. foucaudii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
